TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit DesignerOptionService extends System.Object implements class System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerOptionService
Public MustInherit Class DesignerOptionService Implements IDesignerOptionService

Docs.summary: Provides a base class for getting and setting option values for a designer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerOptionService> class provides a collection of options. Each of these option collections has an indexer that enables it to be further filtered. Each option collection contains its own set of options, as well as a rollup of all of its child options. In the event of a naming conflict between properties, the outermost options object takes precedence. The following **Tools | Options** user interface (UI) structure shows how the outermost options object takes on greater importance:
**WindowsFormsDesigner | General**
- **SnapToGrid**
- **ShowGrid**
- **GridSize**
Given a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerOptionService> named `service`, to get to the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ParentControlDesigner.GridSize%2A> property, you would make the following call:
[!code-cpp[IDesignerOptionServiceExample#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/IDesignerOptionServiceExample/CPP/idesigneroptionservicecontrol.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[IDesignerOptionServiceExample#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/IDesignerOptionServiceExample/CS/idesigneroptionservicecontrol.cs#2)] [!code-vb[IDesignerOptionServiceExample#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/IDesignerOptionServiceExample/VB/idesigneroptionservicecontrol.vb#2)]
This works, until you want to move <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ParentControlDesigner.GridSize%2A> to another page. Also, <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerOptionService> provides no discovery mechanism. If you do not know what string to pass in, the service cannot find the property value.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerOptionService> class addresses these issues. You can query collections, and there is a type converter defined on the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerOptionService.DesignerOptionCollection> object that marks the collection as expandable. With this type converter, you can pass the entire designer option service to a property window and visually inspect the service.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates accessing the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerOptionService> to display the current values of the standard options.
[!code-csharp[System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerOptionService#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerOptionService/CS/designeroptionservicecontrol.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerOptionService#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerOptionService/VB/designeroptionservicecontrol.vb#1)]

Docs.param: The parent designer option collection. All collections have a parent except the root object collection.
The object providing properties for this collection. Can be if the collection should not provide any properties.
Docs.summary: Creates a new with the given name and adds it to the given parent.
Docs.returns: A new with the given name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `value` parameter specifies an object whose public properties are used in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerOptionService.DesignerOptionCollection.Properties%2A> collection of the option collection. The `value` parameter can be `null` if this options collection does not offer any properties. Properties are wrapped in such a way that passing anything into the component parameter of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor> is ignored, and the `value` object is substituted.

Docs.summary: Gets the options collection for this service.
Docs.value: A populated with available designer options.

remarks.format:
## Remarks There is always a global options collection that contains child collections.
## Examples The following code example shows how you can navigate the collections by named indexers so you can get the value of the `GridSize` option. All three variations return the same value.
[!code-csharp[System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerOptionService#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerOptionService/CS/designeroptionservicecontrol.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerOptionService#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerOptionService/VB/designeroptionservicecontrol.vb#3)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerOptionService.PopulateOptionCollection%2A> method is called on demand the first time a user asks for child options or properties of an options collection.
You can populate the `options` collection by calling the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerOptionService.CreateOptionCollection%2A> method and passing this collection as the parent.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerOptionService.ShowDialog%2A> method must be implemented for the `optionObject` parameter's options dialog box to be shown.
